name: Pinballin - Can't D-Cide
description:
An entry to the 2018 University of Portsmouth Game Jam.

This 2 player competitive pinball game won the Best Game Design and Best Use of Technology awards.

Created initially to work with two custom control boxes simulating the tactile feel of a traditional pinball machine, utilising an arduino to interface with the computer and a solenoid to add a tactile feel to the control boxes.

Electronic engineering completed by George Brown

Programming responsibilities George Brown and Dominic Noble (Utilising Unreal Blueprints)

Art - Dominic Noble

Design - George Brown and Dominic Noble

This was a great Jam and we were so shocked to have won any awards at all and really appreciate everyone who voted us for Best Design and our thanks to the judges for picking us for best use of technology!

Note; currently this only supports keyboard input, will try and get around to adding multiple gamepad support.

Controls are Q & W for Left side flippers, with E launching left side's balls

O & P control right side flippers with I launching right side's balls
